job.title: Software Quality Engineer
job.description:
SHAPE THE FUTURE OF MOBILITY FROM DAY ONE.
This position is part of our Advanced Safety and User Experience segment located in Troy MI.
Summary (About This Position)
We have an exciting opportunity for a Software Quality Engineer. This person will be responsible for assigned projects to provide independent assurance and appropriate visibility to the project team and to management that work products meet defined quality criteria. The project team activities conform to the defined common processes and to approved project plans.
Candidate Profile
The successful candidate for this position is has significant experience with software and systems development throughout the lifecycle and is adaptable to a changing business environment.
Excellent problem solving and people skills are a must. The candidate successful in filling this role is a self-starter motivated by achieving ambitious goals, a multi-tasker who promotes quality thinking throughout the project team in the best interest of product quality.
Responsibilities
Supports the Software Quality Project Leader as needed
Defines the quality sampling strategy and authors the Quality Assurance Plan
Provides mentoring to project team
Performs assigned checks, audits and tracks non-conformances through resolution to closure
Supports the Lead to create project quality status
Participates in Engineering, build, major customer milestone and production release audits and activities, and approves software releases
Leads efforts to root cause software Product Complaint Records in conjunction with associated project teams
Reports SQE activities and results
Must Haves (i.e. Basic Qualifications)
Engineering Undergraduate Degree required in Business or Engineering preferred
A deep understanding of systems and software development, DFMEA/PFMEA, Functional
Safety and working across the enterprise – able to challenge engineering or supplier’s technical analysis
Potential candidates should have automotive background experience
Experience leading quality personnel and presenting solutions and improvement plans
Deep understanding of Quality Systems and industry requirements (IATF 16949, 26262, ASPICE). Also, understanding of Automotive APQP (Advanced Product Quality Planning)
Ability to travel is desirable
Strong and efficient oral, written and comprehension English language skills
Nice To Haves (i.e. Preferred Qualifications)
Engineering Quality Assurance experience.
Experience with Polarian.
Automotive SPICE or CMMI assessor qualified.
IATF 16949 qualified.
ISO 26262 (or Safety) trained.
Experience working in the Automotive industry.
Aptiv Rewards And Advantages
Competitive compensation with bonus potential
Competitive health benefits
401K with matching contribution
Learning and development opportunities
Recognition for innovation and excellence
Meaningful work that makes a difference in the world
Relocation assistance (if applicable)
About Advanced Safety & User Experience
Advanced Safety & User Experience encompasses our deep expertise in centralized computing platforms, advanced safety systems and automated driving, while acknowledging the growth in areas that enrich the in-vehicle experience.
